title: 11k-Mile 2012 Cadillac Escalade Platinum AWD at No Reserve
description: This 2012 Cadillac Escalade Platinum has 11k miles following registration history in California since new, and it was purchased by the seller in January 2025 from the original owner. It is finished in Mocha Steel Metallic over Cocoa and Very Light Linen leather and is powered by a 6.2-liter Vortec V8 that drives all four wheels through a six-speed automatic transmission and a locking rear differential. Equipment includes a sunroof, power-retractable running boards, and a Strut grille and license-plate panel as well as 22" multi-spoke wheels, a rearview camera, heated and ventilated power-adjustable front seats, heated second-row seats, removable third-row seats, an 8″ infotainment touchscreen, and a rear-passenger DVD entertainment system. This GMT900 Escalade is now offered at no reserve with a damage-free Carfax report and a clean California title in the seller's name.
author: bringatrailer
excerpt: Bid for the chance to own a No Reserve: 11k-Mile 2012 Cadillac Escalade Platinum AWD at auction with Bring a Trailer, the home of the best vintage and classic cars online. Lot #183,875.
text: This 2012 Cadillac Escalade Platinum has 11k miles following registration history in California since new, and it was purchased by the seller in January 2025 from the original owner. It is finished in Mocha Steel Metallic over Cocoa and Very Light Linen leather and is powered by a 6.2-liter Vortec V8 that drives all four wheels through a six-speed automatic transmission and a locking rear differential. Equipment includes a sunroof, power-retractable running boards, and a Strut grille and license-plate panel as well as 22″ multi-spoke wheels, a rearview camera, heated and ventilated power-adjustable front seats, heated second-row seats, removable third-row seats, an 8″ infotainment touchscreen, and a rear-passenger DVD entertainment system. This GMT900 Escalade is now offered at no reserve with a damage-free Carfax report and a clean California title in the seller’s name. The truck is finished in Mocha Steel Metallic, and exterior equipment includes a Strut grille, license-plate panel, and badging as well as a sunroof, power-retractable running boards, a power-operated liftgate, a roof rack, rear parking sensors, heated power-adjustable side mirrors, and LED headlights with IntelliBeam. A blemish on the front-left door is noted. The truck has 22″ multi-spoke wheels that are mounted with Bridgestone tires. The truck is equipped with all-speed traction control, a Road Sensing Suspension, and StabiliTrak stability control. Braking power is provided by discs at each corner. The front-right wheel has curb marks. The cabin is trimmed in a combination of Cocoa and Very Light Linen leather that extends to the heated and ventilated power-adjustable front seats, heated second-row bucket seats, removable third-row seats, center console, and doors. Interior appointments include a rearview camera, an 8″ infotainment touchscreen, a 10-speaker Bose surround sound system, a six-disc CD stereo, a rear-passenger DVD entertainment system, heated and cooled cupholders, power-adjustable pedals, cruise control, and three-zone automatic climate control. The wood- and leather-trimmed steering wheel fronts a 160-mph speedometer, a tachometer, and gauges for coolant temperature and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 11k miles, approximately 300 of which were added under current ownership. The 6.2-liter Vortec V8 is equipped with variable valve timing and was rated at 403 horsepower and 417 lb-ft of torque when new. An oil change was carried out in January 2025. Power is routed to all four wheels through a six-speed automatic transmission and a locking rear differential. The Carfax report shows no accidents or other damage. It also lists at least one open recall. You are not connected to real-time updates. Attempting to connect. Your real-time updates could not be connected. html:
This 2012 Cadillac Escalade Platinum has 11k miles following registration history in California since new, and it was purchased by the seller in January 2025 from the original owner. It is finished in Mocha Steel Metallic over Cocoa and Very Light Linen leather and is powered by a 6.2-liter Vortec V8 that drives all four wheels through a six-speed automatic transmission and a locking rear differential. Equipment includes a sunroof, power-retractable running boards, and a Strut grille and license-plate panel as well as 22″ multi-spoke wheels, a rearview camera, heated and ventilated power-adjustable front seats, heated second-row seats, removable third-row seats, an 8″ infotainment touchscreen, and a rear-passenger DVD entertainment system. This GMT900 Escalade is now offered at no reserve with a damage-free Carfax report and a clean California title in the seller’s name.

The truck is finished in Mocha Steel Metallic, and exterior equipment includes a Strut grille, license-plate panel, and badging as well as a sunroof, power-retractable running boards, a power-operated liftgate, a roof rack, rear parking sensors, heated power-adjustable side mirrors, and LED headlights with IntelliBeam. A blemish on the front-left door is noted.

The truck has 22″ multi-spoke wheels that are mounted with Bridgestone tires. The truck is equipped with all-speed traction control, a Road Sensing Suspension, and StabiliTrak stability control. Braking power is provided by discs at each corner. The front-right wheel has curb marks.

The cabin is trimmed in a combination of Cocoa and Very Light Linen leather that extends to the heated and ventilated power-adjustable front seats, heated second-row bucket seats, removable third-row seats, center console, and doors. Interior appointments include a rearview camera, an 8″ infotainment touchscreen, a 10-speaker Bose surround sound system, a six-disc CD stereo, a rear-passenger DVD entertainment system, heated and cooled cupholders, power-adjustable pedals, cruise control, and three-zone automatic climate control.

The wood- and leather-trimmed steering wheel fronts a 160-mph speedometer, a tachometer, and gauges for coolant temperature and fuel level. The digital odometer indicates 11k miles, approximately 300 of which were added under current ownership.

The 6.2-liter Vortec V8 is equipped with variable valve timing and was rated at 403 horsepower and 417 lb-ft of torque when new. An oil change was carried out in January 2025.

Power is routed to all four wheels through a six-speed automatic transmission and a locking rear differential.

The Carfax report shows no accidents or other damage. It also lists at least one open recall.
